208362062923574 fb208362062923574
Dasyam Vinay Bhaskar ( born on 22nd November, 1969) is an Indian politician who is currently serving as a Member of Legislative Assembly from Warangal West constituency, Telangana. He is the brother of the former Sports Minister of Andhra Pradesh, Late Shri. Dasyam Pranay Bhaskar. Dasyam Vinay Bhaskar won the Assembly elections in the year 2009 and has been serving as an MLA since.
He was born in Warangal, Telangana to Shilothri Devi and Dasyam Rangaiah, former Engineer in the Electricity Department. He received his early education from Kakatiya High School and St.Gabriel’s High School, Warangal and went on to do his Post graduation in Political Science from BR Ambedkar University. He took up politics after the demise of his brother and contested in the 1999 assembly elections as an Independent candidate and secured 37,000 votes. He contested again in the year 2004 as an Independent candidate and lost with a narrow margin of 1,500 votes.
He contested in 2009 for Assembly elections from Telangana Rastra Samiti party and got elected as the Member of The Legislative Assembly. He resigned soon after he got elected to protest against Congress government in favour of separate statehood of Telangana. He won the byelection with a huge majority of 70,000 votes in 2010. Since then he has taken active part in the Telangana agitation movement and played a major role in the formation of the separate state. He was arrested twice for raising his voice in support of the formation of the separate state. In 2015, he was appointed as a Parliamentary Secretary for the Chief Minister’s Office. He is socially responsible and organised many awareness camps on the Effects Of Plastic and was successful in making Warangal Plastic Free. He also took special interest in organising multiple Blood Donation Camps.
1986 Started career with Telugu Desam Party as Division President 1987-1988 Worked as Telugu Desam Party city youth member 1990-1994 Served as District Party Youth Committee Member in Telugu Desam Party 1997 Went on to become District TNTUC President 1998 Worked as Telugu Desam Party Incharge in Hanamakonda Constituency 1999 Contested as an Independent candidate & secured 37,000 votes 2000-2004 Founder of Telangana Karmika Aikya Vedika
Formed many trade unions in organised and unorganised sectors & fought for the rights of organised and unorganised labour 2004 Contested as an Independent candidate and secured 59,100 votes. Lost narrowly with a margin of 1,416 votes 2005 Joined Telangana Rashtra Samiti and participated actively in the Telangana movement 2006 Got elected as a Corporator from Warangal for the 37th Division
During his term, he provided amenities to most of the Government schools and Orphanages
His Division was also recognised as a Clean and Green division 2007 Served as Telangana Rashtra Samiti Urban President
Took an active part in the Telangana agitation
Worked hard to strengthen Telangana Rashtra Samiti in Warangal (Urban)
Formed Division Committees 2009 Fought for assembly elections from Telangana Rashtra Samiti and won with a Margin of 6684 votes 2010 Resigned from his position to protest against the Congress government in order to achieve separate statehood for Telangana 2010 - 2014 Telangana Movement Participated in Chalo Assembly

Protested against Andhra Pradesh Formation Day

Was house arrested for protesting

Was arrested twice for raising his voice in support of Telangana

Worked towards providing uninterrupted power supply to farmers during which he was arrested by the Octopus squad

Organised multiple Blood Donation camps

Encouraged sportsmen by conducting various sports events

Provided hand wash areas and basic amenities in schools in collaboration with ASCI under the program Mana Badi Mana Badyata

Organised many awareness camps on the effects of plastic and was successful in making Warangal plastic free

Was invited twice to attend the Young Leaders Summit held in Indian School of Business

Was recognised as the Most Approachable MLA in united Andhra Pradesh in a survey conducted by a popular local News channel (CNN IBN) 2015 Was appointed as a Parliamentary Secretary for the Chief Minister’s office
Strived hard to bring Warangal under Hriday and Amrit Scheme and was successful in achieving it. We are dedicated to working towards making Warangal a tourist destination. We would appreciate it you join hands with us in making our vision a reality. Kindly fill up the suggestion form below and share your ideas with us.
